result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven L. Wissbroecker

defendant.name: Wissbroecker, Steven L.
defendant.address: N11673 County Road Z, Elcho, WI 54428

records.addlTxt:
Final pre-trial on January 9, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial on January 25, 2023 at 08:30 am.
of Proceeding - Preliminary Hearing - Held on 06-02-22

1:43 PM Defendant Steven L. Wissbroecker appeared by video, in custody, via zoom.  Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Steven L. Wissbroecker.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Bennett has copy of information, reserve right and enters Not Guilty plea.  State notes Information tracks amended complaint. CC receives not guilty plea & extend time limits.
Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:00 PM/Rm. 301/Defendant Steven L. Wissbroecker in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Steven L. Wissbroecker in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter by Zoom.  On State's motion, Court finds Cts. 1 and 2 are transactionally related.  State moves Court find Cts. 3 through 8 are transactionally related.  Def.'s Atty. objects.  It is not stipulated so State will have to prove.  Deputy Travis Krueger, duly sworn on oath, testifies.  State rests.  Def.'s Atty. asks to continue the preliminary hearing.  State requests bind over on all counts.  Response by Def.'s Atty.  Further argument by State.  Court finds no issue about counts being transactionally related.  Court will not give a continuance of preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause on Cts. 1 and 2 and Cts. 3 through 8 and binds case over for filing of information.  Def.'s Atty. makes bond argument.  State asks, if any victim appearing by Zoom, if any comments regarding bond.  No response.  State gives response to bond argument.  Further arguments by Def.'s Atty.  Def.'s Atty. can refile request.  Motion for bond modification denied.  Victim rights complied with.  Arraignment scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:53 PM Defendant Steven L. Wissbroecker in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett, via zoom.  Defendant Steven L. Wissbroecker in custody, vai zoom.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven L. Wissbroecker appeared by video means with Attorney.  Atty Bennett has copy of amended complaint, waives reading and request timely preliminary hearing.  Atty Bennett will be present in court for next hearing.  Bond Continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

04:08 PM Defendant Steven L. Wissbroecker in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven L. Wissbroecker appeared by video means. All parties via zoom. Court reads amended criminal complaint with charges and penalties. Court gives defendant atty options. Def. is going to private hire Atty Bennett. State heard on condition of bond.  No intentional contact with domesticated animals. Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No contact with any minors.
No contact with alleged child victim.
Not to leave State of WI 
Surrender passport to Langlade County Sheriff Office.

01:18 PM Defendant Steven L. Wissbroecker in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven L. Wissbroecker appeared by video means. All parties via zoom.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. is going to contact P.D. State gives bail/bond recommendation.  State is in compliance with victim rights. Defendant heard on bond. Court orders $100,000 cash bond with conditions, No contact with any minors, No contact with child victim. Not to leave State of Wisconsin. Surrender passport to Langlade County Sheriff Office.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
